body.p: The majority of the respondents on the Exposure Draft disagreed with the proposed approach to the year‑to‑date calculation of diluted earnings per share. The most significant argument against the proposed approach was that the proposed calculation of diluted earnings per share could result in an amount for year‑to‑date diluted earnings per share that was different for entities that report more frequently, for example, on a quarterly or half‑yearly basis, and for entities that report only annually. It was also noted that this problem would be exacerbated for entities with seasonal businesses.
